intro: Antidesma sylvestre, commonly known as the African starfruit or wild starfruit, is a shrub or small tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with a rough texture. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in cupular inflorescences. Its fruit is a fleshy, star-shaped berry that turns red when ripe, often containing a single seed. The plant is adapted to dry and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
